meta.content: Serving Idaho: Clearwater County, Idaho County, Latah County, Lewis County, and Nez Perce County. Serving as the Region’s Public Health Leader to: Prevent Disease, Promote Healthy Lifestyles, Protect and Prepare the Public Against Health Threats.

h3.strong: Public Health - Idaho North Central District Monitoring and Tracking of Coronavirus

p.em: Idaho currently has ongoing confirmed cases of novel coronavirus as of 3/17/20. Public health officials and community partners are monitoring this outbreak closely and are coordinating and communicating accordingly.
The following are confirmed COVID-19 cases for Public Health - Idaho North Central District jurisdiction of Clearwater, Idaho, Latah, Lewis, and Nez Perce Counties.

table.caption: Numbers Updated: 04/28/2020 | 3:00p.m. PST | Monday - Friday. All data are preliminary and subject to change.

td.p: Confirmed Cases: A person with a positive laboratory test result for COVID-19 using a molecular amplification technique (e.g., PCR, NAAT).
Probable Cases: Symptomatic people that have epidemiologic risk factors or evidence of infection detected or SARS-CoV-2 as contributing to death without laboratory confirmation.

table.caption: Numbers Updated: 04/28/2020 | 3:00p.m. PST | Monday - Friday. All data are preliminary and subject to change.
Numbers Updated: 04/28/2020 | 3:00p.m. PST | Monday - Friday. All data are preliminary and subject to change.

div.p: For statewide case counts, visit coronavirus.idaho.gov | Current COVID-19 U.S. case counts

h3.strong:
Idaho Governor Brad Little issues statewide Stay-Home Order.
Click here for more information.

br.strong: Questions about COVID-19 or the Statewide Stay-Home order call: 1-888-330-3010.
br.br: Monday through Friday, 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. PST.

hr.div: Public Health - Idaho North Central District Hotline: 866-736-6632 Due to the high volume of calls we are receiving, rather than being placed on hold, you will be asked to leave your name and number and we will return your call as soon as possible.

h3.strong: RESOURCES, GUIDANCE, AND PROTOCOLS FOR BUSINESSES:

p.strong: IDAHO REBOUNDS: Guidance for the re-opening of food establishments has not yet been released by the State of Idaho, but it is expected to be released by Wednesday, April 29th. At that time, we will post it here on our website. Rest assured, the re-opening process will NOT involve an in-person inspection by a Health Inspector! As a food establishment owner, you will be expected to develop a plan for how you will address the issues identified in the guidance in order to re-open.
